channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: アマゾンがインドの動画ストリーミングサービスMX Playerの主要資産を買収、情報筋によると買収額は1億ドルで、2019年の評価額5億ドルを下回る（Manish Singh/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Manish Singh / TechCrunch:
Amazon acquires key assets of Indian video streaming service MX Player; a source says the deal values the streamer at $100M, below its $500M valuation in 2019  —  Amazon has agreed to acquire key assets of Indian video streaming service MX Player from the local media powerhouse Times Internet …

item.title: オンライン・ニュースレターを提供する英国の地域ニュース新興企業ミル・メディアは、イブニング・スタンダード紙が規模を縮小する中、ロンドンで事業を開始し、グラスゴーに事務所を開設する計画だ（Daniel Thomas/Financial Times）。
item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
Regional UK news startup Mill Media, which offers online newsletters, plans to launch in London, as the Evening Standard scales back, and open a Glasgow office  —  Regional UK news start-up says there is an opportunity after years of savage cutbacks in local media industry

item.title: マイクロソフトはMSN.com向けにBNNのコンテンツをライセンス供与していた。
item.description:
New York Times:
A look at the now-shuttered news site BNN Breaking, which former staff say mostly published AI-generated content; Microsoft had licensed BNN content for MSN.com  —  The news was featured on MSN.com: “Prominent Irish broadcaster faces trial over alleged sexual misconduct.”

item.title: ニュージーランドの『Stuff』は、記事に対する読者の反応を尋ねるセンチメント・トラッカーと、論争的な記事に対するソフトな説明者スタイルをどのように使い分けているか（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
How New Zealand's Stuff is using a sentiment tracker, which asks readers for their response to stories, and a softer explainer-style for contentious stories  —  New Zealand's Stuff “abandoned” the traditional inverted pyramid structure for its “most contentious” stories as part of its battle against news avoidance.

item.title: 生成AI画像共有サイトで人気アニメキャラの画像9万点超を分析、～2.5万点が原画と複数類似（日経アジア）
item.description:
Nikkei Asia:
An analysis finds 90K+ images of popular anime characters on generative AI image sharing sites; ~2.5K images had multiple similarities to the original artwork  —  —An animator working for a Tokyo-based production company  —  “This Pikachu” was drawn by generative AI.

item.title: 情報筋コストコ、2025年1月より米国店舗での書籍の通年販売を中止し、代わりに年末商戦期に販売する計画（ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: Costco plans to stop selling books regularly at US stores year-round from January 2025, and will instead sell them during the holiday shopping period  —  The decision, which will be implemented in January 2025, could significantly impact publishers.

item.title: 情報筋ワシントン・ポスト紙のウィル・ルイスCEOが、2024年5月、サリー・バズビー氏が関与した英国の電話ハッキング訴訟に関する記事を掲載した際の判断力を批判（ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: Washington Post CEO Will Lewis criticized Sally Buzbee's judgment in publishing a May 2024 article about a UK phone-hacking lawsuit that involved him  —  Will Lewis, the chief executive of The Washington Post, objected to coverage of a legal development involving him in a phone hacking case.

item.title: 教育出版社4社がグーグルを提訴、教科書の海賊版を宣伝し著作権侵害通知を無視したと非難（Blake Brittain/Reuters）
item.description:
Blake Brittain / Reuters:
Four educational publishers sue Google, accusing it of promoting pirated copies of their textbooks and ignoring copyright infringement notices  —  Google (GOOGL.O) was hit with a lawsuit on Wednesday by educational publishers Cengage, Macmillan Learning, McGraw Hill and Elsevier accusing …

item.title: Stability AI、最大47秒のサンプルと効果音を生成するテキスト音声モデル「Stable Audio Open」をリリース、商用利用は禁止（Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Kyle Wiggers / TechCrunch:
Stability AI releases Stable Audio Open, a text-to-audio model for generating up to 47 seconds of samples and sound effects, prohibited for commercial use  —  Stability AI, the startup behind the AI-powered art generator Stable Diffusion, has released an open AI model for generating sounds …

item.title: ニュージャージー州知事、州公文書公開法の見直し法案に署名、ジャーナリストや市民が文書を入手しにくくなると批判（Mike Catalini/Associated Press）
item.description:
Mike Catalini / Associated Press:
New Jersey's governor signs a bill overhauling state public records law; critics say the bill makes it harder for journalists and the public to get documents  —  New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy signed legislation on Wednesday overhauling access to the state's public records …

item.title: YouTubeは、監視団体の報告から1年後の6月18日から、18歳未満の視聴者が実際に銃を使用することに関連する一部のコンテンツを制限する計画だ（Will Shanklin/Engadget）
item.description:
Will Shanklin / Engadget:
YouTube plans to restrict some content pertaining to the real use of guns from viewers under 18 starting on June 18, a year after a watchdog group report  —  Last year, a nonprofit flagged gun-related videos recommended to children's accounts.  —  YouTube quietly snuck in a policy change …

item.title: バイスの創設者シェーン・スミスがバイス・ニュースのEICに復帰。
item.description:
The Wall Street Journal:
Vice founder Shane Smith returns as Vice News EIC, but with no management responsibilities, and will host a series of shows and create social media content  —  Shane Smith is sorry, but not sorry.  The 54-year-old co-founder of Vice Media said he has few regrets as he embarks on a new role at the company …

item.title: 亡命ウイグル人ジャーナリスト、カシム・カシュガルの元同僚5人が中国新疆ウイグル自治区で収監された。
item.description:
Liam Scott / Voice of America:
Five former colleagues of exiled Uyghur journalist Kasim Kashgar have been imprisoned in China's Xinjiang region, seemingly over their ties to the VOA reporter  —  Former colleagues of exiled Uyghur journalist Kasim Kashgar have been imprisoned in China's Xinjiang region …

item.title: Netflixの外部ゲーム担当副社長リアン・ルームに、同サービスにおけるインタラクティブ・フィクション・ゲームの人気、リアリティ番組などについてインタビュー（Ash Parrish/The Verge）
item.description:
Ash Parrish / The Verge:
An interview with Netflix VP of External Games Leanne Loombe about the popularity of interactive fiction games on the service, reality TV shows, and more  —  And while the “serious gamer” might be enticed by the pending arrival of The Case of the Golden Idol or Don't Starve Together …

item.title: The Atlanticのニコラス・トンプソンCEOがOpenAIとの契約の詳細を語る：パブリッシャーは、完全に依存することを避ける限り、技術プラットフォームから利益を得ることができる（Sarah Scire/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Sarah Scire / Nieman Lab:
The Atlantic CEO Nicholas Thompson shares details on the OpenAI deal: publishers can benefit from tech platforms as long as they avoid becoming wholly dependent  —  Shortly before The Atlantic announced “a product and content” partnership with OpenAI, the magazine published a piece …
